item.title: 拖延症患者团结起来人工智能教官可能会让你继续完成任务
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社遍布全球的记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，Ellen Huet 将探讨人工智能能否帮助您实现新年愿望。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. item.title: 贝森特与耶伦一道发出债务警告，却开出了相反的药方
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们将探讨斯科特-贝森特领导下的美国财政部的前景。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. item.title: 诺贝尔奖获得者要求 "登月 "科技努力消除饥饿危机
item.description: 150 多位诺贝尔奖和世界粮食奖获得者表示，与约翰-肯尼迪总统在 20 世纪 60 年代提出的将人类送上月球的倡议一样，另一项巨大的努力也亟需帮助：战胜饥饿。【原文：Echoing President John F. Kennedy’s initiative to put man on the moon in the 1960s, more than 150 Nobel and World Food Prize laureates say urgent help is needed for another mammoth effort: Fighting hunger.】

item.title: 拜登时代结束时的美国学生债务比他上任时还多
item.description: 乔-拜登总统的标志性承诺之一是减轻数百万美国人的学生贷款负担。他离任时，债务总额将比他上任时略有增加。【原文：One of President Joe Biden’s signature promises was to ease the student-loan burden on millions of Americans. He’ll leave office with the debt pile slightly bigger than when he arrived.】

item.title: 英国经济增长乏力可能导致里夫斯的预算出现 300 亿英镑的缺口
item.description: 彭博社的计算显示，如果财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的计划是基于伦敦金融城的最新预测，而不是英国官方的经济增长预测，那么她将面临 300 亿英镑（367 亿美元）的黑洞。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves would be left with a £30 billion ($36.7 billion) black hole if her plans were based on up-to-date City forecasts instead of the UK’s official growth projections, Bloomberg calculations show.】

item.title: 瑞典房地产公司 Heimstaden 在资金紧张的情况下发行债券
item.description: 瑞典房地产公司 Heimstaden AB 正在发行新票据，以抵御因其子公司欧洲大房东 Heimstaden Bostad 分红枯竭而加剧的流动性压力。【原文：Swedish real estate company Heimstaden AB is marketing new notes as part of its bid to fend off liquidity pressures intensified by the drying-up of dividends from its subsidiary, major European landlord Heimstaden Bostad.】

item.title: Davidson Kempner 将出售葡萄牙希尔顿酒店和假日酒店
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Davidson Kempner Capital Management LP 计划出售葡萄牙北部的两家酒店，以利用人们对该国酒店资产日益增长的兴趣。【原文：Davidson Kempner Capital Management LP plans to sell two hotels in northern Portugal, taking advantage of growing interest in hospitality assets in the country, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街复杂交易策略的良好开端
item.description: 无论你怎么评价今年到目前为止的市场，它都不会让人感到乏味。【原文：Say what you will about the year so far for markets, it hasn’t been boring.】

item.title: 西班牙桑切斯失去加泰罗尼亚盟友，预算谈判受挫
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗-桑切斯（Pedro Sanchez）的一个重要盟友表示，将中断所有谈判，这对正在寻求批准新预算的社会党政府是一个打击。【原文：A key ally to Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said it’s breaking all negotiations, landing a blow to the Socialist government as it seeks to approve a new budget.】

item.title: 肯尼亚表示，贸易协定将使对阿联酋的肉类和园艺产品销售量增加两倍
item.description: 据非洲国家贸易部的一位高级官员称，肯尼亚和阿拉伯联合酋长国之间达成的一项协议将使非洲国家对海湾国家的肉类和园艺产品出口增长三倍。【原文：An agreement between Kenya and the United Arab Emirates could boost the African nation’s meat and horticultural exports to the Gulf country threefold, according to a top trade ministry official in the African nation.】

item.title: 铃木印度分公司计划出口电动车，奋起直追
item.description: 马鲁蒂铃木印度有限公司（Maruti Suzuki India Ltd.）周五推出了首款电动汽车，在追赶竞争对手的同时，该公司正计划将印度打造成一个能够向 100 个国家出口电动汽车的制造中心。【原文：Maruti Suzuki India Ltd., which rolled out its first electric car Friday as it plays catch-up with rivals, is planning to make India a manufacturing hub that can export electric vehicles to 100 countries.】

item.title: 巨型电池正在改造世界电网
item.description:
近年来，全球能源存储容量增加了两倍，这要归功于十年前几乎不存在的行业。【原文：

Global energy storage capacity has tripled in recent years, thanks to an industry that barely existed a decade ago.

】

item.title: 特朗普的关税威胁已令垃圾债市场恐慌
item.description:
银行家们正在赶在美国总统就职典礼之前完成融资交易。贷款人向借款人提出各种问题，并降低风险。【原文：

Bankers are rushing to get financing deals done ahead of the US president’s inauguration. Lenders are swamping borrowers with questions and cutting risk.

】

item.title: 棕榈树公司获得 12 亿美元用于家庭太阳能，并希望将其翻番
item.description: 棕榈清洁技术公司在 2024 年筹集了 12 亿美元，用于资助住宅太阳能和家庭电气化项目，该公司表示，今年的目标是将这一数额翻一番。【原文：Palmetto Clean Technology raised $1.2 billion in 2024 to finance residential solar and home electrification projects and aims to double that amount this year, the company said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔警告不要仓促降息，Platow 报道
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）告诉《Platow Brief》，考虑到不确定性加剧和持续存在的通胀风险，欧洲中央银行谨慎降息是正确的。【原文：The European Central Bank is right to be cautious in cutting interest rates considering heightened uncertainty and lingering inflation risks, Governing Council member Joachim Nagel told Platow Brief.】

item.title: 花旗证券递交中国执照申请
item.description: 肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel Securities 提交了在中国大陆设立经纪公司的申请，为扩张铺平了道路，而大多数华尔街公司却在中国市场上举步维艰。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel Securities handed in its application to establish a brokerage in mainland China, paving the way for expansion while most Wall Street firms are struggling to navigate the country’s markets.】

item.title: 微软股价重振有赖于人工智能狂潮带来的增长
item.description: 微软公司在人工智能领域投入了数百亿美元。随着其股价的挣扎，问题的关键在于如何尽快证明这些投资是成功的。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has plowed tens of billions of dollars into artificial intelligence. With its stock struggling, the key question is how quickly those investments can prove to be successful.】

item.title: 维珍航空在忠诚俱乐部变更后吸引英国航空乘客
item.description: 维珍大西洋航空公司（Virgin Atlantic Airways Ltd.）正在努力争取英国航空公司（British Airways）的忠诚计划客户，这些客户对最近的变化感到不满，因为这些变化使得获得或保留顶级身份的成本更高。【原文：Virgin Atlantic Airways Ltd. is seeking to win over loyalty program customers from British Airways who are disgruntled about recent changes that have made it more expensive to earn or retain top-tier status.】

item.title: 市场螺旋式下滑，私人信贷向陷入困境的英国敞开钱包
item.description: 在其他投资者纷纷退出英国市场的时候，马克-乔里穆图已经做好了准备。【原文：As other investors bail on British markets, Marc Chowrimootoo is ready to dive in.】

item.title: 韩国可能考虑增加美国食品进口以安抚特朗普
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，韩国可能会考虑增加美国食品进口的计划，以帮助减少两国之间的贸易不平衡，如果这成为与唐纳德-特朗普即将上任的政府之间的一个紧张点的话。【原文：South Korea may consider a plan to increase US food imports to help reduce the trade imbalance between the two countries should it emerge as a point of tension with Donald Trump’s incoming administration, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通亚太区股票辛迪加联席主管瓦格西据说将离职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s co-head of Asia Pacific equity capital markets syndicate, Aditi Varghese, has left the bank, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 里夫斯称监管机构阻碍了英国经济增长
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）表示，英国监管机构正在阻碍英国政府提振自去年 7 月工党执政以来陷入低迷的经济。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said UK regulators are preventing her government from boosting an economy that has flat-lined since Labour came to power last July.】

item.title: 荣耀首席执行官赵明（George Zhao）在公司上市准备阶段卸任
item.description: 荣誉设备有限公司（Honor Device Co.据这家总部位于深圳的智能手机制造商称，公司首席执行官赵明（George Zhao）因个人原因离职。【原文：Honor Device Co. Chief Executive Officer George Zhao is stepping down due to personal reasons, according to the Shenzhen-based smartphone maker.】

item.title: 中国采取行动阻止苹果、比亚迪在亚洲各地的生产转移
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国正在加大印度和东南亚高科技制造业所需的员工和专用设备出境的难度，这可能是为了防止企业因美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提高关税而转移生产。【原文：China is making it harder for employees and specialized equipment needed for high-tech manufacturing in India and Southeast Asia to leave its borders, according to people familiar with the matter, a possible attempt to prevent companies from shifting production in anticipation of higher tariffs under US President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 沙索计划重振化工部门并探索首次公开募股的可能性
item.description: 据沙索有限公司首席执行官称，该公司正在寻求重振其国际化工业务，包括一个庞大的美国综合体，以提高收益，并为其上市提供可能。【原文：Sasol Ltd. is looking to revive its international chemical business, including a sprawling US complex, to boost earnings and open up an option to potentially list it, according to the company’s chief executive officer.】

item.title: 挪威为 18 万亿美元主权财富基金首席执行官刊登广告
item.description: 挪威央行开始接受该国1.8万亿美元主权财富基金负责人的申请，现任基金负责人尼古拉-坦根（Nicolai Tangen）被认为有可能连任。【原文：Norway’s central bank opened applications for head of the country’s $1.8 trillion sovereign wealth fund with incumbent Nicolai Tangen seen as likely to be reappointed.】

item.title: 纳格尔呼吁下届德国政府修复濒临崩溃的经济
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，德国的增长潜力多年来一直受到忽视，促进德国经济切实复苏的任务掌握在下一届政府手中。【原文：The task of fostering a meaningful recovery for Germany is in the hands of the next government after years of neglect hurt its growth potential, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 中美贸易战提前打响，为特朗普加征关税铺平道路
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）还未于周一就职，世界最大经济体之间的贸易紧张局势就已升温。【原文：Even before Donald Trump takes office on Monday, trade tensions between the world’s biggest economies are already heating up.】

item.title: 华尔街的特朗普新玩法：无视噪音，继续前进
item.description: 华尔街交易员都知道唐纳德-特朗普重返白宫会带来什么：深夜在社交媒体上发布的政策转变、对贸易伙伴的威胁以及大量的市场波动。【原文：Wall Street traders know what to expect from Donald Trump’s White House return: policy shifts rolled out in late night social-media posts, threats to trading partners, and plenty of market volatility.】

item.title: 三星高管将在重大改革中以股票形式获得部分奖金
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co.）首次决定以股票而非现金支付高管的部分奖金，在公司芯片制造陷入困境之际，将薪酬与股票业绩挂钩。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. has decided to pay part of executives’ bonuses in stock rather than cash for the first time, linking pay to share performance at a time the company is struggling with chipmaking.】
